item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #51
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Daniel Schmachtenberger In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) Rhys interview Daniel Schmachtenberger, the co-founder of Neurohacker Collective. They chat about meta existential risk. Enjoy! About Me: My name is Rhys Lindmark and I’m a hyper curious and intentional social entrepreneur. My “deep why” is the transition to GameB. […]

item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #47
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Lawrence Lundy In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Richard Burton, the co-founder of Balance, a UX and financial services-focused crypto wallet. We chat about wallet standards, how ETH/EOS fail, and how crypto can help us escape the scarcity mindset. Enjoy! About Me: My name is Rhys Lindmark and I’m a hyper curious […]

item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #46
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Lawrence Lundy In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Liv Boeree on some updates to the Fermi Paradox, the power of consequentialism, and how to think probabilistically. Enjoy! About Me: My name is Rhys Lindmark and I’m a hyper curious and intentional social entrepreneur. My “deep why” is the transition to GameB. I podcast + steward ETHCommons + […]

item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #45
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Lawrence Lundy In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Lawrence Lundy-Bryan, a partner and the Director of Research at Outlier Ventures. We chat about his Convergence Theory and an evolutionary perspective on competitive capital allocation. Enjoy! About Me: My name is Rhys Lindmark and I’m a hyper curious and intentional social entrepreneur. My “deep why” […]

item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #44
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Ethan Zuckerman In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Ethan Zuckerman, the director for MIT’s Center for Civic Media. We chat about his skepticism of crypto social networks and the historical co-evolution of information and governance. Enjoy! Here are some links: https://www.wired.com/story/decentralized-social-networks-sound-great-too-bad-theyll-never-work/ https://www.media.mit.edu/projects/gobo/overview/ http://graphics.wsj.com/blue-feed-red-feed/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parlio https://mediacloud.org/ https://civilservant.io/ Designing and Building a Healthy Space […]

item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #43
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Cheryl Yeoh & Wendy Xiao Schadeck In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Cheryl Yeoh from #MovingForward and Wendy Xiao Schadeck from NorthzoneVC. We chat about intentionality and diversity in crypto. Dialectics between identity and power, yay! Enjoy! item.title: Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future #42
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Eric Meltzer In this episode of Creating a Humanist Blockchain Future (Soundcloud, Youtube, iTunes) I interview Eric Meltzer, a Partner at INBlockchain — China’s largest blockchain focused fund, and the curator of Proof of Work, a newsletter that highlights the progress of top projects. We chat about the Asian crypto scene, investing as a crypto VC, and his newsletter Proof-of-Work. Enjoy! About Me: […]
